abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column discusses investment professional Robert L Colby's analysis of company stock repurchases; notes Colby’s study, which compared net profit growth and earnings-per-share of one company to those of comparable firm that bought back loads of shares, confirms buybacks are growth mirage, and proves corporations can do much better with even small reinvestment in production.

headline.print_headline: Dispelling the Illusion Behind the Buybacks
headline.main: A Simple Test to Dispel the Illusion Behind Stock Buybacks

snippet: Comparing a company’s growth in earnings per share, which can be raised by buying back stock, with its net profit growth can paint a more accurate picture of performance over time....
